intro: Rochea perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate rochea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dark green, heart-shaped leaves that are often perforated at the base, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Rochea perfoliata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
